options.content: Data for $host with $interval resolution

panels.description:
Percent of Memory Available
Note: on Modern Linux Kernels amount of Memory Available for application is not the same as Free+Cached+Buffers

targets.expr: (node_memory_MemAvailable{instance=~"$host"} or (node_memory_MemFree{instance=~"$host"} + (node_memory_Buffers{instance=~"$host"} or up * 0) + (node_memory_Cached{instance=~"$host"} or up * 0))) / node_memory_MemTotal{instance=~"$host"} * 100

panels.title: Memory Available

panels.description: Sum of disk space on all partitions. Note  it can be significantly over-reported in some installations
panels.title: Disk Space

panels.description: Lowest percent of the disk space available
panels.title: Min Space Available

targets.expr: clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host",mode!="idle"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu{instance=~"$host",mode!="idle"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{instance=~"$host", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!=""}[$interval]) or avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{instance=~"$host", mode!="total", mode!="idle", mode!=""}[5m]))),100)

panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage

targets.expr:
node_memory_MemTotal{instance=~"$host"} + node_memory_SwapTotal{instance=~"$host"} - 
((node_memory_MemAvailable{instance=~"$host"} or 
(node_memory_MemFree{instance=~"$host"} + node_memory_Buffers{instance=~"$host"} + node_memory_Cached{instance=~"$host"})) + 
node_memory_SwapFree{instance=~"$host"})

(rate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{instance=~"$host"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{instance=~"$host"}[5m]) * 1024 or rate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{instance=~"$host"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{instance=~"$host"}[5m]) * 1024) + (rate(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readKbPS{instance=~"$host",device=~"rdsdev|rdstemp"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readKbPS{instance=~"$host",device=~"rdsdev|rdstemp"}[5m]) * 1024 or rate(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeKbPS{instance=~"$host",device=~"rdsdev|rdstemp"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeKbPS{instance=~"$host",device=~"rdsdev|rdstemp"}[5m]) * 1024)

panels.description: Shows average latency for Reads and Writes IO Devices.  Higher than typical latency for highly loaded storage indicates saturation (overload) and is frequent cause of performance problems.  Higher than normal latency also can indicate internal storage problems.
panels.title: Disk IO Latency

panels.description: Shows how much disk was loaded for reads or writes as average number of outstanding requests at different period of time.  High disk load is a good measure of actual storage utilization. Different storage types handle load differently - some will show latency increases on low loads others can handle higher load with no problems.
panels.title: Disk IO Load

panels.description: Total Number of Local Network Interface Transmit Errors, Receive Errors and Drops.  Should be  Zero
panels.title: Local Network Errors
